qa_pairs.question: How do you activate the acute stroke page for ICH patients?
qa_pairs.source_section: I. At initial presentation to the Emergency Department (ED)

qa_pairs.question: What is the target systolic blood pressure for ICH patients?
qa_pairs.answer: Target SBP = 140 mm Hg. Blood pressure goal should be attained within 30 minutes of diagnostic CT of the head.

qa_pairs.question: What is the first-line antihypertensive for ICH?
qa_pairs.answer: First line: Nicardipine drip 5 to 15 mg/h

qa_pairs.question: What is the alternative to nicardipine for blood pressure control?
qa_pairs.answer: Alternative: Clevidipine Infusion. Initial Dose 1 to 2 mg/hr, Double the dose every 90 seconds until desired blood pressure goal, Maximum dose 32 mg/hr for short term use

qa_pairs.question: What reversal agent is used for warfarin-associated ICH?
qa_pairs.answer: Vitamin K 10 mg IV (10 mg in 10 ml IV push) over 10 minutes (monitor for hypotension/anaphylaxis) AND Four-Factor PCC (Kcentra): INR 2 to <4 or unknown (25 Units/Kg, max 2500 Units), INR 4 to 6 (35 Units/Kg, max 3500 Units), INR >5 (50 Units/Kg, max 5000 Units)

qa_pairs.question: What is the ICH score and when should it be documented?
qa_pairs.answer: Document ICH score within 6 hours of presentation

qa_pairs.question: What seizure management is recommended for ICH patients?
qa_pairs.answer: Treat any patient with seizure with Ativan 0.1 mg/kg (max: 8 mg) & Fosphenytoin (or phenytoin equivalent) 20 mg/kg IV load or Levetiracetam (Keppra) 1 g /IV. See status epilepticus protocol if patient continues to seize.

qa_pairs.question: What reversal is recommended for antiplatelet agents in ICH?
qa_pairs.answer: For any patient with antiplatelet (Aspirin, Aggrenox, GPIIbIIIa or Clopidogrel) use in last 24 hours and ICH onset within 3 days: DDAVP 0.3 mcg/kg x 1 (20 mcg in 50 cc NS over 15-30 minutes) & Consider one apheresis platelet unit

qa_pairs.question: What is the minimum systolic blood pressure to maintain for ICH patients?
qa_pairs.answer: Maintain SBP > 90; begin with isotonic fluid before starting vasopressors. Consider Neosynephrine or Phenylephrine 2â€“10 mg/kg/min

qa_pairs.question: What is the reversal protocol for dabigatran (Pradaxa)?
qa_pairs.answer: Praxbind (idarucizumab) 5g IV given as bolus or IV infusion. Additional 5 g may be considered if coagulation parameters re-elevate and clinically relevant bleeding occurs or if a second emergency surgery/urgent procedure is required and patient has elevated coagulation parameters.

qa_pairs.question: What labs should be ordered for ICH patients in the ED?
qa_pairs.answer: PT, PTT, INR; Initial Type and Hold; CBC with platelets; Troponin I; Chem7, LFTs; Urine Toxicology screen; 18 and 20 gauge peripheral IVs should be placed

qa_pairs.question: What imaging is required for ICH evaluation?
qa_pairs.answer: Stat Stroke Protocol Head CT w/ CTA (r/o Spot sign). Creatinine level is NOT necessary to give contrast for CTA unless there is a h/o CKD

qa_pairs.question: What are the Mount Sinai Neuro-ICU contact numbers?
qa_pairs.answer: 1) Call 1-800-TO-SINAI to arrange urgent transfer to the MSH or MSR Neuro-ICU; 2) Mount Sinai Neuroemergency Hotline (on-call neuro-intensivist): 1-800-748-6445; 3) Mount Sinai Neuro-ICU: 212-241-2100; 4) Mount Sinai West Neuro-ICU: 212-523-2183

qa_pairs.question: What is the treatment for intracranial hemorrhage after IV tPA?
qa_pairs.answer: Stop TPA; Check CBC, PT, PTT, platelets, fibrinogen, DDimer; 10 units of cryoprecipitate (0.15 units/kg); Consider epsilon-amino caproic acid 4g IV; If still bleeding at 1 hour and fibrinogen still <100 mg/dL repeat cryoprecipitate dose (0.15 units/kg)
qa_pairs.source_section: Treatment of Intracranial Hemorrhage after IV tPA

qa_pairs.question: When should external ventricular drain placement be considered?
qa_pairs.answer: Assess for need for urgent external ventricular drain placement (Unable to follow commands or symptomatic hydrocephalus). If external ventricular drain placed, give Ancef 1 g IV prior to drain insertion and one dose 8 hours later
